techmeme.title: Roy Austin, Meta's VP of Civil Rights and Deputy General Counsel, announces he is leaving the company at the end of March 2025, after joining in January 2021 (Alex Heath/The Verge)
The EU approves Synopsys' $35B Ansys acquisition, after the companies offered to divest parts of their businesses; US and China approvals are still pending (Paul Sawers/TechCrunch)
Biden assailed Meta over its move to end third-party fact-checking on its social media platforms in the US, saying "it's really shameful" (Josh Wingrove/Bloomberg)
How the rise of self-imposed solitude in the US, accelerated by smartphones in the 21st century, is reshaping the country's civic and psychological identity (Derek Thompson/The Atlantic)
OpenAI CEO Sam Altman, Uber CEO Dara Khosrowshahi, and, a source says, Meta CEO Mark Zuckerberg are planning to attend Trump's inauguration events this month (Bloomberg)
